alert.note: Alert for Lee; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 11:53AM EDT until August 05 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky, south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Estill. In south central Kentucky, Rockcastle. In southeast Kentucky, Jackson and Lee. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1152 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area through 3 PM. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Irvine, Ravenna, Blanton Flats, Alcorn, Jinks, Brazil, Locust Branch, Foxtown, Drip Rock, Hisel, Wagersville, Alumbaugh, Station Camp, Waneta, Kerby Knob, Sandgap, South Irvine, Leighton, Doe Creek and Collingsworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
